submission:
class Solution:
    def minChanges(self, nums: List[int], kk: int) -> int:
        n = len(nums)
        dic = defaultdict(int)


        for i in range(n//2):
            dic[abs(nums[i] - nums[n-i-1])]+=1;
        diff =1e9
        # print(dic)

        new_dic = defaultdict(int)
        
        for k,v in dic.items():
            if v in new_dic:
                new_dic[v] = min(new_dic[v],k)
            else:
                new_dic[v] = k
        
        # print(new_dic)

        cnt= 0
        # for k,v in dic.items():
        #     if v>=cnt:
        #         if (cnt==v):
        #             diff = min(diff,k)
        #         else:
        #             diff = k
        #         cnt =v

        # ops =0
        # print("diff",diff)
        # print("cnt",cnt)
        # diff =15
        # cnt=3
        final = 1e9
        for k,v in new_dic.items():
            ops=0
            diff = v
            cnt=k
            for i in range(n//2):
                if (abs(nums[i]-nums[n-i-1]) == diff):
                    continue
                else:
                    # print(i,nums[i],nums[n-i-1])
                    mini = min(nums[i],nums[n-i-1])
                    maxi = max(nums[i],nums[n-i-1])
                    already = maxi-mini;
                    reqd = (diff - already)
                    sign = 1 if reqd>0 else -1
                    reqd = abs(reqd)
                    # print(sign,"sign")
                    # print(mini+(-1*sign)*reqd,maxi+(1*sign)*reqd,0<=(mini+(-1*sign)*reqd)<=kk,0<=(maxi+(1*sign)*reqd)<=kk)
                    if 0<=(mini+(-1*sign)*reqd)<=kk or 0<=(maxi+(1*sign)*reqd)<=kk:
                        # print("ops added 1")

                        ops+=1
                    else:
                        # print("ops added 2")
                        ops+=2
            final = min(final,ops)
        return final;
